title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 452.1 - Election of procedure
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 452.1 - Election of procedure

State Regulations

An insured or prospective insured who has reason to believe
himself aggrieved, by a premium differential assigned to his policy rate, may
protest such assigned differential by the means hereinafter specified. If the
insured or potential insured elects to proceed under the means hereinafter
specified, he shall be deemed to have elected such means as the exclusive means
for challenging such differential, and to have relinquished any and all other
rights to offer any challenge he may have possessed, whether at common law or
otherwise. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 12

452.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
